title: Money primarily allows me to:
description: Rate each of the following statements in terms of their truth for you (0 = not at all like me; 1 = a little like me; 2 = a lot like me; 3 = exactly like me)

questions.text: Buy things or experiences that bring me joy.
Create freedom for other pursuits (i.e. creativity, spirituality, social activism, philanthropy).
Have a sense of security and abundance.
Be recognized for my gifts and reach more people.
Believe things will work out for the best.
Take care of others or donate to charities.
Invest in something that makes a lasting impact.

title: My money truths are:
description: Rate each of the following statements in terms of their truth for you (0 = not at all like me; 1 = a little like me; 2 = a lot like me; 3 = exactly like me)

questions.text: I don't like thinking about money.
I use my money to help family, friends, or others in need.
I like to shop, travel, and spend money on things that make me happy.
Steadily growing account balances are an essential component of a fulfilled life for me.
By organizing my finances and keeping things in control, I can feel safer.
Money causes so many problems for society â€“ we should overhaul our economic system.
Money can help me build something important and enduring.
I spend money in ways that will inspire others.
